newsitem.title: USA: Chateau urges shareholders not to tender.
newsitem.headline: Chateau urges shareholders not to tender.

text.p: Chateau Properties Inc said Wednesday it is repeating its recommendation that shareholders not tender shares to Manufactured Home Communities Inc's offer of $26 a share.

"We once again strongly urge Chateau stockholders not to tender into the MHC offer," the company said, adding that it recommends those who have done so "exercise their right to withdraw their shares".
The boards of directors of Chateau and ROC Communities Inc approved a revised merger last month. Chateau said earlier it remains committed to that transaction.
Earlier Wednesday, MHC extended its offer until November 6.
Chateau noted that the number of shares tendered to MHC as of October 22, according to MHC's statement, was less than stated in the release of October 2, the last day of the initial offer period.
As of October 1, MHC said about 2.995 million shares had been tendered. As of October 22, MHC put the number at about 2.7 million.

"In light of the substantial number of shares which we believe are held by professional arbitrageurs and other short-term holders, we surmise that these holders own a significant portion of the tendered shares," Chateau said.
